arm_group.description: Collecting pre-operative and per-operative data, neuro-radiological data and post-operative complications

brief_summary.textblock:
Patients undergoing a brain tumour neurosurgery with craniotomy may present rare but
      lifethreatening post-operative complications. There are currently no strong recommendations
      to help the clinician in an attempt to properly hospitalise these patients after their
      intervention (Neuro-ICU, ICU,surgical ward).

      Determining risk factors of post-operative complications could optimise resources. Therefore
      hospitalisation in Neuro-ICU would be mandatory in only a little number of patients.

clinical_study.brief_title: Risk Factors of Complications Regarding Patients Undergoing Brain Tumour Neuro-surgery (Cranioscore).

detailed_description.textblock:
Retrospective analysis of a prospective database to create a Risk Score. Post-operative
      neurosurgery complications recording (Hyponatremia < 135mmol/l,Insulin administration,
      Nausea-Vomiting, Glasgow Coma Score, Inhalation, Post-operative intra-cranial bleeding
      requiring neurosurgery, Intra-cranial hypertension, Use of osmotherapy, Status epilepticus,
      Brain death, Death).

      Collection of datas as Duration of mechanical ventilation, Length of ICU stay, Length of
      hospital stay.

      Validation of this score on an independent prospective cohort.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients undergoing neuro-surgery for a brain tumor

        Exclusion Criteria:
